channel.title: Starter Pack, and character problem
channel.description:
Hi,
I have a question, and a problem.
How do I make a starter pack for new characters, like when they first log in, they have a bunch of items to start off with. I tried a tutorial that told me to go into player.java and find playerEquipment and put an id next to =.
I added a bunch of ids, saved and compiled, but nothing changed. I made a new account and it didn't have the items.
My other problem is my character won't save when I log out.
I'm using cheezscape update 80, and whenever I log out it just says could not save player <player name>.
The server is able to auto save every minute though.
How can I fix this?
P.s. I'm using windows 7 64 bit.

item.title: Starter Pack, and character problem
item.dc:creator: @vinayak vinayak
item.description:
@vinayak wrote:

Yes the folders are there, although when I log off it won’t save.

The server outputs a message saying could not save

The reason I’ve been able to get on with my server is because it’s able to auto save and create the files about every 5 minutes.

I want to make sure my character saves whenever I log off.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter Pack, and character problem
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“vinayak, post:6, topic:357319”]jmood, I don’t have the additem method added, and my character still won’t save. I’m figuring it’s a problem in playerhandler.java, because that’s where the message of my character not saving is set, if you understand why I’m saying

Whenever I log off it says could not save for in this case vinayak.

I would like to fix the save problem first.[/quote]

Make sure the directory where the saving and loading is calling for is created like folder “Characters” or folder “saveGames”.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter Pack, and character problem
item.dc:creator: @vinayak vinayak
item.description:
@vinayak wrote:

jmood, I don’t have the additem method added, and my character still won’t save. I’m figuring it’s a problem in playerhandler.java, because that’s where the message of my character not saving is set, if you understand why I’m saying

Whenever I log off it says could not save for in this case vinayak.

I would like to fix the save problem first.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter Pack, and character problem
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You can use addItem(id, amount); if you have the method added, as for saving and loading that is a bit harder to explain, if your characters save and load but the new starter pack items don’t show that is because the starter items haven’t been added right, saving and loading should work correctly use you delete your saving or loading methods.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter Pack, and character problem
item.dc:creator: @strpkz strpkz
item.description:
@strpkz wrote:

[quote=“xluke, post:3, topic:357319”]@darkswerk

You need to assign a program to the .java file type, or just open it in a plaintext editor, like notepad.

@vinayak
I have no idea, im very sorry. :c[/quote]So you don’t know how to edit starters? Like when i first login?

Read full topic

item.title: Starter Pack, and character problem
item.dc:creator: @vinayak vinayak
item.description:
@vinayak wrote:

Hi,

I have a question, and a problem.

How do I make a starter pack for new characters, like when they first log in, they have a bunch of items to start off with.
I tried a tutorial that told me to go into player.java and find playerEquipment and put an id next to =.

I added a bunch of ids, saved and compiled, but nothing changed. I made a new account and it didn’t have the items.

My other problem is my character won’t save when I log out.

I’m using cheezscape update 80, and whenever I log out it just says could not save player .

The server is able to auto save every minute though.

How can I fix this?
